intro: Echites tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed echites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its slender, erect stems are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Echites tenuicaulis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with limited water availability.
